definition: lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom)/fig. a very slight effort
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: To reform a man is a tedious and uncertain labour; hanging the sure work of a minute.
sentences.chinese: 改造人是冗长而无把握的工作，绞刑则是举手之劳。

sentences.english: Be sure they don’t lift a finger for their special day.
sentences.chinese: 确保他们不举手之劳用于特殊的一天。

sentences.english: We can help to protect Taiwan's nature treasures by just lifting a finger.
sentences.chinese: 我们只要举手之劳，就可以保护台湾的自然资产。

sentences.english: It does with its own highly-trained staff, so you don't have to lift a finger.
sentences.chinese: 它拥有高度训练的职员，所以你不必耗费举手之劳。

sentences.english: It would be so little to You, God, such a little, little thing.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，对你来说这简直就是小菜一碟，举手之劳。

sentences.english: But since it promises easy cash, people believe it.
sentences.chinese: 可是因为只要举手之劳即可赚钱，以人们宁可信其有。

sentences.english: I was so embarrassed, lift a finger, what is there against it?
sentences.chinese: 我很尴尬，举手之劳，何乐而不为呢？

definition: assistance/a helping hand/to lend a hand
as far as one's capabilities extend (idiom); to the best of one's ability/within one's powers
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
